org.dellroad.muxable.simple

Class ChannelIds

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dellroad.muxable.simple.LoggingSupport
      • org.dellroad.muxable.simple.ChannelIds

  • public class ChannelIds
extends LoggingSupport
    Tracks channel ID's for the SimpleMuxableChannel framing protocol.

    A shared instance of this class should be provided to both the ProtocolReader and ProtocolWriter.

    Valid channel ID's are range from one to Long.MAX_VALUE. Channel ID's are never reused. Each side of the connection has its own channel ID namespace. In some cases, when both local and remote channel ID's are being passed around, remote channel ID's are negated to avoid confusion (but this should always be clearly documented). In this class the side of the connection is implied, and the channel ID's are always positive, except for isChannelOpen() and getOpenChannelIds().

    Instances are thread safe.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextLocalChannelId

        public long getNextLocalChannelId()
        Get the next available local channel ID.
        Returns:
        next local channel ID
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if all 263 local channel ID's have already been allocated

      • getNextRemoteChannelId

        public long getNextRemoteChannelId()
        Get the next available remote channel ID.
        Returns:
        next remove channel ID
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if all 263 remote channel ID's have already been allocated

      • allocateLocalChannelId

        public long allocateLocalChannelId()
        Allocate a new local channel ID.
        Returns:
        new local channel ID (always positive)
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if all 263 local channel ID's have already been allocated

      • validateLocalChannelId

        public boolean validateLocalChannelId(long channelId)
        Validate a local channel ID.

        This verifies that channelId is valid and represents a channel allocated via allocateLocalChannelId().

        Parameters:
        channelId - local channel ID
        Returns:
        true if channelId is valid and open, false if valid but released by freeChannelId()
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if channelId is non-positive or not yet allocated

      • allocateRemoteChannelId

        public boolean allocateRemoteChannelId(long channelId)
        Allocate a remote channel ID, if channelId represents the next available remote channel ID to be allocated.

        If channelId represents the next available remote channel ID, then allocate it and return true. Otherwise, return false.

        Parameters:
        channelId - remote channel ID
        Returns:
        true if channelId is the next available remote channel ID which was also just allocated, otherwise false
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if channelId is non-positive

      • validateRemoteChannelId

        public boolean validateRemoteChannelId(long channelId)
        Validate a remote channel ID.

        This verifies that channelId is valid and represents a channel allocated via allocateRemoteChannelId(long).

        Parameters:
        channelId - remote channel ID
        Returns:
        true if channelId is valid and open, false if valid but released by freeChannelId()
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if channelId is non-positive or not yet allocated

      • freeChannelId

        public boolean freeChannelId(long channelId,
                             boolean local)
        Deallocate (i.e., mark as closed) a channel ID previously allocated by allocateLocalChannelId() or allocateRemoteChannelId().
        Parameters:
        channelId - local channel ID
        local - true if local channel ID, false if remote channel ID
        Returns:
        true if channel was actually open, false if channel was already closed
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if channelId is non-positive, never allocated, or already closed

      • isChannelOpen

        public boolean isChannelOpen(long channelId)
        Determine whether the specified channel is still open.
        Parameters:
        channelId - encoded channel ID (positive for local, negative for remote)
        Returns:
        true if channel is still open, false if channel has been closed
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if channelId is invalid or not yet allocated

      • getOpenChannelIds

        public LongSet getOpenChannelIds()
        Get all open channel ID's.

        The returned set contains both local and remote channels, where remote channels are encoded as the negatives of their actual values.

        The returned set is a copy; modifications do not affect this instance.

        Returns:
        all open channel ID's, where remote channel ID's are encoded by negation
